passage.title: My mother is at home
passage.paragraph: One day, Bruce plays in front of a house. A woman comes up and asks Bruce, "Little boy, is your mother at home?"
The the woman goes over to ring the bell. The bell rings and rings, but no one comes to open the door. The woman gets angry and calls out to him, "You tell me your mother is at home, don't you?"
"Yes," the boy answers. "My mother is at home, but this isn't my home."
